alert.note: Alert for Lewis; Mason (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 02 at 12:11AM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHEASTERN MASON, NORTHWESTERN LEWIS, SOUTHEASTERN BROWN AND SOUTHERN ADAMS COUNTIES THROUGH 1245 AM EDT... At 1210 AM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was located over Aberdeen, moving east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Hail may cause minor damage to outdoor objects. Locations impacted include... Maysville, West Union, Manchester, Ripley, Aberdeen, Vanceburg, Rome, Blue Creek, Concord, Sandy Springs, Trinity, Moranburg, Dunkinsville, Carrs, Bradysville, State Route 348 at State Route 125, Bentonville, Somo, Cedar Mills and Herron Hill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
